meanings.definition: To change the arrangement or formation of something.
meanings.sent1: She reconfigures her room layout every month.
meanings.sent2: The software reconfigures the settings automatically.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces reconfigure themselves when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: His innovative thinking reconfigures the traditional approach to problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes reconfigure the blank canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To adjust or alter the structure or design of something.
meanings.sent1: He reconfigures the car engine for better performance.
meanings.sent2: The architect reconfigures the building plans to include more windows.
meanings.sent3: The chef reconfigures the recipe to add a unique twist.
meanings.sent4: The tailor reconfigures the dress to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reconfigures the experiment setup for accurate results.
